Hull or keel reinforcement is an easy way to improve a vehicle or vessel's durability. Extremely old vessels, such as most of those fielded by the Rebel Alliance, can also benefit from a hull or keel reinforcement by shoring up damaged or fatigued hull members and adding support bracing at strategic locations. 

[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various models.

ItemAttachments.Name: Ram Attachment
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Ram Attachment[h3]

For the most part, collisions with other ships, vehicles, or obstacles are to be avoided at all costs. There are times, however, when a desperate situation calls for a desperate measure and a pilot or driver must use his vehicle as a weapon. A number of bolt-on accessories for ships and vehicles are produced by major vehicle manufacturers that protect and reinforce prows or forward sections against collision. Items such as bantha bars, sloped fenders known colloquially as "nerfcatchers," and custom-fit reinforced hull plating are all examples of the rich after market dedicated to protecting a vehicle in case of collision. 

[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various models.

Mod.MiscDesc: Treats the starship or vehicle's defense as 2 higher when instigating a collision.
Add 1 more defense when instigating a collision.

ItemAttachments.Name: Slave Circuit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Slave Circuit[h3]

An old shipbuilding technology perfected millennia ago, slave circuits allow ship owners to operate their ships, or various systems within their ships, via remote control. Occasionally referred to as the "Electronic Co-Pilot" or "Instant Backseater," slave circuits run all of a ship's systems through a central system bus that can be activated and deactivated via voice command through a comlink-like device called a "beckon call." Basic slave rigs allow a user to remotely activate a ship's systems and bring it to complete operational readiness, or to shut those systems down and lock out all users until a security code is entered. More advanced models allow the user to call the ship to his present location, and even allow it to fight its way there with moderate success. While popular in many circles, slave circuits are often mistrusted by ship owners. 

[P][B]Models Include:[b] Corellian Engineering Corporation "Savant" Ship Slave Rig, Incom ST-9x.4 "Backseater" Starfighter Slave System.

Mod.MiscDesc: Allows a ship or vehicle to be activated or deactivated by remote control.
Allows ship or vehicle to move to the owner's location using owner's Piloting skill.
Allows ship or vehicle to autonomously use its weapon systems using owner's appropriate skill.

ItemAttachments.Name: Holonet Pirate Array
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Holonet Pirate Array[h3]

Life in the galaxy has arisen in all manner of biomes, from the deep seas of Mon Cala to the Ithorian jungles, and every possible climate in between. Most starship life-support systems create an environment in the median range, neither too hot nor too cold, neither too humid nor too dry. When members of a particular species need unique accommodations, they must turn to their own shipwrights, or modify acquired ships appropriately. Diplomats often take the additional step of adapting their ships to be capable of replicating a wide range of environments, the better to make passengers and guests feel at home.

Mod.MiscDesc: Transmissions sent with this attachment can reach any facility that has access to interstellar communications.  Transmissions can be intercepted with a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b], provided someone is aware of the transmission.
Add setback to enemy checks to intercept outgoing transmissions.
Add boost to intercept HoloNet traffic

ItemAttachments.Name: Luxury Passenger Compartments
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Luxury Passenger Compartments[h3]

Corrupt Imperial officials and powerful crime lords are more likely than Rebels to enjoy opulent living standards. However, Rebels who have regular contact with the rich and powerful sometimes find a little extravagance to be a purely practical investment. While scented air recyclers, a galley stocked with Corellian brandy, and other luxuries have little measurable effect on the Rebel war effort, the intangible benefits offered by a display of confidence and power should not be underestimated.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BO] to all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation checks made against passengers within the vehicle.  Checks made against passengers who are accustomed to opulence and luxury have up to [SE][SE] removed instead.

ItemAttachments.Name: Advanced Subspace Encryption Array
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Advanced Subspace Encryption Array[h3]

The Empire's tight grip on the HoloNet forces the Rebellion to rely primarily on subspace transceivers for communications. However. subspace transceivers have a much more limited range than HoloNet transmissions, requiring frequent relays across additional networks before reaching the intended recipient. Risk of interception of a relayed transmission limits Rebel operations, forcing them to rely on courier ships and secret comm stations for long-range communication. However, ships with advanced encryption algorithms can send coded transmissions that blend with normal traffic, rendering them nearly undetectable and all but indecipherable even if they are intercepted.

Mod.MiscDesc: Only the intended recipient can detect a transmission  sent with this attachment without a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b].
Upgrade the difficulty of any checks to intercept or decipher transmissions made from this attachment once.
Add setback to enemy detection check
Add setback to enemy interception or deciphering check

ItemAttachments.Name: Environmental Simulators
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Environmental Simulators[h3]
Life in the galaxy has arisen in all manner of biomes,
from the deep seas of Mon Cala to the Ithorian jungles, and every possible climate in between. Most
starship life-support systems create an environment
in the median range, neither too hot nor too cold, neither too humid nor too dry. When members of
a particular species need unique accommodations,
they must turn to their own shipwrights, or modify
acquired ships appropriately. Diplomats often take
the additional step of adapting their ships to be capable of replicating a wide range of environments, the
better to make passengers and guests feel at home.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can replicate up to three different planetary environments, one at a time.  When making Charm or Negotiation checks against members of species native to replicated environment, add an automatic [AD][AD] to pool.
Additional planetary environment

ItemAttachments.Name: Electronic Countermeasures Suite (Custom)
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Electronic Countermeasures Suite (Custom)[h3]
      [P]Blocks sensors within range when active, counting the Tallanx’s silhouette as 2. Immediately notifies all ships in a star system, or within 100 kilometers if planetside, to the Tollonx’s existence.
      [P][I]This is an optional no-cost attachment for the Tallanx-Class Stealth Fighter and the Darvro-Class Light Freighter.[i]

Mod.MiscDesc: Blocks sensors within range, counting the ship's silhouette as one smaller when being fired upon.
Immediately notifies all ships in a star system or within 100 kilometers if planetside to the ship or vehicle's existence.

ItemAttachments.Name: Gimmellian Stealth Device
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Gimmellian Stealth Device[h3]
[P]Reduces the range band of enemy ships’ passive sensors by 1 (to a minimum of close range) for detecting the Tallanx. In order to function, all power from shields and weapons must be channeled into the cloaking device. Rerouting power takes one action.    
      [P][I]This is an optional no-cost attachment for the Tallanx-Class Stealth Fighter and the Darvro-Class Light Freighter.[i]

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduces range band of enemy ships' passive sensors by 1 (to a minimum of close range) for detecting the Tallanx.
All power for shields and weapons must be rerouted to device for it to work.  Rerouting takes one action.

ItemAttachments.Name: Electronic Sighting System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Electronic Sighting System[h3]
[P]By adding a small electronic device to the top of a blaster or other ranged weapon, a small holographic crosshair is projected a meter out from the weapon’s barrel. This increases accuracy by reducing the time it takes for the user to aim. Unfortunately, the holographic crosshair is readily visible to anyone on the weapon’s receiving end, especially in conditions of darkness or low light. This attachment can be used on any ranged weapon that could logically benefit from the addition of a sight.

Mod.MiscDesc: Allows shooter to aim as an incidental once per round at short range.  Decreases the difficulty of Perception checks to locate the shooter in low light conditions by 1.

ItemAttachments.Name: Weapon Signature Reduction
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Weapon Signature Reduction[h3]
[P]Both the Empire and the galactic security industry use weapon scanners that are capable of detecting a wide variety of weapon components. Even when broken down into several pieces, blasters and other ranged weapons are still liable to be detected, due to the specific technologies and substances that allow them to function as lethal weapons.
[P]In order to skirt such inspection and ensure that hidden weapons remain obscured from prying eyes, covert agents have devised modifications that mask or otherwise diminish such signatures in a weapon’s components. Though physical searches still pose some risk of discovery, weapon signature reduction guarantees that scanning equipment used to detect weapons is rendered less effective. Unfortunately, weapon signature reduction is only effective on weapons with an encumbrance rating of 5 or less.

Mod.MiscDesc: Increase the difficulty checks using scanners to search for this weapon by 2.  Add [SE] to all Mechanics checks to perform maintenance on this weapon.

ItemAttachments.Name: Cyclic Crystal Array
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Cyclic Crystal Array[h3]
[P]Lightsabers rely on kyber crystals attuned to the wielder to create energy blades of different types. Under normal circumstances, swapping out one crystal for another is an arduous process requiring the lightsaver to be disassembled first. Unsatisfied with this situation, a handful of enterprising (if unorthodox) Force users have created attachments that allow for two (or more) crystals to be installed in a single lightsaber. With the press of a button, one crystal is swapped for another, granting unprecendented versatility to lightsaber wielders looking for additional functionality from their otherwise traditional weapon. This attahment can only be applied to lightsabers.

Mod.MiscDesc: When lightsaber is ignited, may choose which active crystal to use.  If already ignited, activating another crystal requires a maneuver.

ItemAttachments.Name: Energy Overclock Setting
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Energy Overclock Setting[h3]
[P]As deadly and dangerous as they are, vibroweapons can be even deadlier with the cinclusion of an overclock setting. By replacing several internal components with precision analogs, a qualified technician can exponentially increase the speed and frequency of a vibroblade's blade action. The result is a vibroweapon that can be charged for amplified cutting power, but at the expenseof causing unpredictable power fluctuations. This attachment can be applied to any vibroweaponand any other powered Melee or Brawl weapon.

Mod.MiscDesc: Once per turn, spend a maneuver to add Vicious +3 to weapon until end of round.  [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] causes weapon to cease functioning until end of encounter.
Add automatic Advantage to combat checks with this weapon
Activate as an incidental instead of a maneuver

ItemAttachments.Name: Force-Attuned Resonator
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Force-Attuned Resonator[h3]
[P]When the Jedi artificer Sokiro Terebin set about reproducing the crystalline, force-attuned resonaters from the blasters she had unearthed at Site-145 on Filata, she first had to solve some numerious technical challenges. During this time, she created a number of internal resonaters that could be housed within a weapon the effectiveness of differnt technologies the ancients might have used. Though she meticulously recorded all of her efforts to create resonators that could be activated only by Force sensitives, the Empire's tumultuous rise to power led the destruction of many repositiories of Jedi lore. During Terebin's lifetime, few Jedi considered these weapons to be serious armaments, but in the dark times of Imperial rule, some Force sensitives might find having a blaster that most people can't operate to be practical. The blueprints persist in certain scholastic records, and the aspiring Force sensitives might be able  to make a use of them. This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) weapon that has a trigger.

Mod.MiscDesc: Must possess Force Rating 1+ to operate this weapon.

ItemAttachments.Name: Integrated Illuminator
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Integrated Illuminator[h3]
[P]Operating in darkness is never ideal, but there are several ways to compensate for one's lack of night vision. The simplest, perhaps, is to integrate a simple spotlight, similar in most respects to a high-power glow rod, along the length of a ranged weapon's barrel. In addition to providing illumination in dark conditions, high-powered spotlights have the potential to blind enemies. This attachment can be applied to any ranged weapon that could logically benefit from a spotlight.

Mod.MiscDesc: Removes up to [SE][SE] due to darkness on targets within short range.
Increase spotlight range to medium

ItemAttachments.Name: Magnetic Weapon Tether
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Magnetic Weapon Tether[h3]
[P]A magnetic weapon tether is a reelatively simple modification that consists of a small magnetic device built into the weapon. The magnetic weapon tether allows the wielder to snap the weapon back to a readied position with a press of a button, rather than havin gto scramble to retrieve it. While many Force users might scoff at this ability - after all, why use a device for what they can do with the force anyway - others prefer to have the exra layer or safety, or wish to avoid using their Force powers openly in places where the Empire's presence is strong. This attachment can be applied to any weapon wielded in one hand that could logically benefit from a weapon tether.

Mod.MiscDesc: Wielder may recover engaged weapon as incidental.

ItemAttachments.Name: Kimber Stone
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Kimber Stone[h3]
[P]Kimber stones are a type of kyber crystal produced by violent volcanic activity on the moon of Y'ness in the N'zoth system. They were once considered unsuitable for use in lightsabers due to the non-lethal nature of the blades they create. Certain Jedi Knights saw potential in kimber stones, and so a number were acquired from Y'ness prior to the destruction of the Jedi Order. Today, kimber stones are occassionally sold at auction on the black market, usually as mere trinkets by those who do not understand their true value as kyber kristals. A kimber stone is a lightsaber crysal.

ItemAttachments.Name: Sorian Crystal
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Sorian Crystal[h3]
[P]Though none can confirm accurately from which planet these mysterious stones originate, many traders recognize these gems byy their radiance. Sorian crystals are said to reflect light in swirling, intricate patterns reminiscent of dancing flames. Because of these gems' relative scarcity, few realize that they are in fact kyber cystals. The energy blade formed by a sorian crystal surges briefly with teh power whenever it comes into contact with another object moving at high speed - such as another lightsaber. The slight but sudden jolt  that emanates from the blade is often enough to throw an attacker off balance, giving the wielder a chance for a counterstrike. While this dded resistance also makes it harder to slice apart an opponent in a single stroke over the course of a long duel between skilled fighters, the unique edge it provides can make the difference between life and death. A sorian crystal is a lightsaber crystal.

Mod.MiscDesc: When used with the Parry talent, add [BO] to next combat check made against attacker before the end of the next round.

ItemAttachments.Name: Shield Discharge Pack
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Shield Discharge Pack[h3]
[P]Despite being nearly as ancient as warfare, shields continue to be popular weapons, serving as trusted defenders of warriors on low-tech planets and protecting life and limb of security forces in densely populated areas. While shields are useful weapons already, adding discharge packs to them can allow the wielder to deliver a debilitating shock when delecting a hit. Further, just the sight of a crackling arc of energy wreathing a shield can disturb many would-be attackers, making their strikes far more timid - and far less lethal - than they would have been otherwise. This attachment can only be applied to a shield or buckler.

Mod.MiscDesc: When wielder suffers hit from Melee, Brawl, or Lightsaber combat check, may spend [TH][TH] or [DE] to cause attacker to suffer 3 strain, ignoring soak.

ItemAttachments.Name: Armor Spikes
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Armor Spikes[h3]
[P]While armor serces a largely defensive role for its wearers, that needn't be the rule. With the addition of spikes, blades, and other protrusions on areas covering shoulders, knuckles, feet, knees or elbows, armor can be turned ino a deadly weapon of last resort. The majority of such modifications are scratch-built, though a handful o f armor manufacturers mass-produce kits for the armor sets they sell. Largely popular with criminals, mercenaries, and bounty hunters, armor spikes lend an intimidating mien to anyone equipped with them. Some professionals prefer to keep such deadl modofications concealed and retractable, and these are perhaps the most dangerous of them all. This attachment can be attached to any armor that covers the arms or legs.

Mod.MiscDesc: When wearer suffers a hit from a Melee, Brawl, or Lightsaber combat check, may spend [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] to inflict one hit for 6 damage on attacker.
Increase damage to attacker by +1

ItemAttachments.Name: Quick Shed
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Quick Shed[h3]
[P]Armor, especially heavy armor, takes time to put on and take off. though putting armor on remains a chore, taking it off - especially in an emergency situation - is expedited with the quick shed attachment. By installing several quick-release latches at strategic locations, suits of armor can be quickly removed by the wearer. This attachment can only be applied to armor with an encumberance of 3 or higher.

Mod.MiscDesc: As a maneuver, wearer by shed the armor.  Armor must be reassembled before donning again, requiring several minutes and an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b].

ItemAttachments.Name: Low-Friction Coating
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Low-Friction Coating[h3]
Low-friction coatings work by lowering the coefficient of friction against solid armor plates. With the addition of such a coating, the surface of armor becomes almost impossible to grip or seize. In addition, glancing blows frommelee weapons are often unable to find purchase, which diminishes the damage they cause as they slide off. The only downside to the coating is that is can make working on the armor more difficult, as tools must scramble for a grip on its slick surface. This attachment can only be applied to armor with hard surfaces such as heavy battle armor, powered armor.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [SE][SE] to Mechanics checks to modify of maintain armor.

ItemAttachments.Name: Kiirium Coating
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Kiirium Coating[h3]
      [P] An obselte shielding material once processedin abundance in the Si'klaata Cluster, kiirium was at one time vital to the manufacture of heavy weapons and starships. While largely supplanted by cheaper, more durable alloys, kiirium has properties that make it useful to armorsmiths, who can apply a coating of kiirium to armored plating as a relatively effective thermal shielding. This attachment can only be applied to armor that has hard or solid parts around which the allow can be coated, such as with laminate armor, heavy battle armor, and similar types of armor at the GM's discretion.

Mod.MiscDesc: +1 soak vs. blaster and flame attacks
Decrease the difficulty of Resilience checks made to resist the effects of fire and extreme heat by 1

ItemAttachments.Name: Hardened
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Hardened[h3]
[P]Power armor relies on its energy source to maintain functionality. If this flow of energy is interrupted by a powerful electromagnetic burst or exposure to ion weapons, the armor losesboth its mobility and its ability to enhance the wearer.  With the armor's vital systems "hardened" against such effects, power armor becomes immune to these attacks. Such hardening modifications are weighty, however. Adjustments must be made to nearly every subsystem to prevent even partial shutdowns from taking place. This attachment can only be applied to power armor.

Mod.MiscDesc: Prevents deactivation of power armor by electromagnetic or ion weapons.

ItemAttachments.Name: Reflec Shadowskin
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Reflec Shadowskin[h3]
[P]An advanced, light-absorbing polymer that can be applied to armor, refec shadowskin coating can enhance the stealth abilities of its wearer - anyone wearing armor covered in this substance can easily blend into the shadows. While this coating does not make the wearer invisible, it does mean that observers who only catch a glimpse are far less likely to register what they saw or believe it to be anything more than a trick of the light. This attachment can only be applied to armor with a soak of 2 or lower.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add automatic [AD] to Stealth checks
Add setback to Perception checks to see wearer

ItemAttachments.Name: Stun Matrix
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Stun Matrix[h3]
[P]A stun matrix is an additional defensive option for armor. Instead of enhancing the wearer's defenses directly, it unleashes a punishing pulse of energy that weakens the attacker in the hope of preventing a second strike. Installing this attachment requires the addition of insulation to protect the wearer form the effects of the stun matrix on top of the setup of the self charging battery and of the stun matrix itself. While the device is relatively bulky, it can be concealed if integrated subtly into a heavy armor frame, the better to surprise would-be attackers. This attachment can be applied to any armor that could logically benefit from having a stun matrix added.

Mod.MiscDesc: When suffering hit from Melee, Brawl, or Lightsaber combat check, may spend [TH][TH] or [DE] to disorient attacker for 2 rounds.
May spend three Threat or Despair to immobilize attacker for 1 rounds
May spend Despair to stagger attacker for 1 rounds

ItemAttachments.Name: Reactive Plating
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Reactive Plating[h3]
[P]Reactive plating is a modification that attaches small explosive panels to the armors exterior plates. When hit by an attack, the explosives are designed to detonate outward, absorbing some of the attacks kinetic energy with the counter-explosion. It is not typically used on a personal scale, but microrepulsors and other, similar technologies allow it to be integrated into certain heavier varieties of personal armor and to function at considerable effectiveness without harming the wearer in the process. Employed properly, reactive armor can even deflect or dampen blows from weapons that would cleave through other defenses, like lightsabers. Besides the considerable weight it adds to any set of armor, an unfortunate side-effect of reactive armor is that it destroys itself as it protects the individual inside. It causes the armor to degrade far more rapidly than it would have otherwise would, which means that the wearer must repair it far more often. This attachment can only be applied to armor with a soak of 2 or higher.

Mod.MiscDesc: First time wearer is hit each encounter, reduce damage by 10.  After, armor suffers minor damage and must be repaired to function again.

ItemAttachments.Name: Lightsaber Hilt Construction Modifications
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Lightsaber Hilt Construction Modifications[h3]
      Use this attachment to reflect the results of a lightsaber hilt construction check, as required.
ItemAttachments.Source: Force and Destiny Game Master's Kit

ItemAttachments.Name: Engine Ring Stabilizer
ItemAttachments.Description: [H3]Engine Ring Stabilizer[h3]

ItemAttachments.Name: Slicing Computer
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Slicing Computer[h3]
Although most starships include sophisticated computers and comm equipment capable of slicing into the systems of enemy vessels, such electronic warfar tactics are usually overlooked in favour of more  conventional attacks. However, some crews undertake efforts to upfrade their on-board systems for precisely the kind of work. With the right equipment  and software, a skilled computer expert can cecome one of the most vaulable crew members in a space battle. Many Technicians continue to tinker with and add to the ship's computer systems over time, sometimes to the confusion and frustration of other crew. This attachment can be applied to any starship.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various Custome Models

Mod.MiscDesc: Counts as slicer gear that can be used by one passenger.
Add automatic [AD] to Computers checks made to slice enemy ships' systems.

ItemAttachments.Name: Secondary Transponder
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Secondary Transponder[h3]
Although it is possible to modify a ship's transponder signal, doing so is either easily detected or risks damaging the engines, depending on the method used. Mounting a secondary transponder to the engine is a one-time modification that allows the ship's crew to thereafter switch between two identities. When activated the secondary transponder overrides the data signal from the ship's primary transponder, while also generating an energy signature that disguises the activity of the ship's engine (these are the twp parts of a transponder signal). The cost of this attachment includes a false or stolen identity in Bureau of Ships and Services (BoSS) records. This attachment can be applied to any starship.
[P][B]Models include:[b] Various Illicit Models

Mod.MiscDesc: Crew can switch to the secondary transponder as an action, making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b].
An observer who scans the ship can detect discrepancies indicating the presence of a secondary transponder with a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b].
Activate secondary transponder as a maneuver
Add one additional ship identity

ItemAttachments.Name: Security Measures
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Security Measures[h3]
There are few things to befall a ship owner more dreaded than to have a craft disappear from an unsecured landing pad. Even aside from the threat of theft, there are many reasons why a crew might want to keep uninvited guests off their ship while it's unattended - especially for any crew engaged in less-than-legal pursuits. Upgraded mag-locks, decoy control panels, reinforced hatches and enhanced security protocols can ensure that a ship goes undisturbed while at port. This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Corellian Engineering Corporation SecurePro, Kuat Drive Yards LockDown Plus

Mod.MiscDesc: Upgrade the difficulty Computers and Skulduggery checks made to gain unauthorized access to the ship twice.
Add setback to Computers and Skulduggery checks made to gain unauthorized access to thei ship

ItemAttachments.Name: Overcharged Ion Engines
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Overcharged Ion Engines[h3]
People living on the fringes of galactic society - and those involved in criminal pursuits, in particular - often need to move more quickly when things turn bad. Overcharged ion engines allow a ship to accelerate more quickly, but tend to be damaging to ship systems over time. Many shipwrights view the use of such modifications as mistreatment of their works, but some pilots swear by the edge it gives them. This attachment acan be applied to any starship of silhouette 3 or smaller.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Gallofree Yards Option-3 Acceleration Optimizer, Various Custom Models.

ItemAttachments.Name: Pseudo-Cloaking Device
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Pseudo-Cloaking Device[h3]
While true cloaking devices are all but unhead of and limited to capital ships, so-called "pseudo-cloaks" incorporate an array of electronic masking devices and countermeasures to render a ship almost invisible to sensors. However, such devices have no visual effect, limiting their usefulness in close-range engagements. This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Fabritech Gx-3 Sensor Screen, Sienar Intelligence Systems Electronic Masking System

Mod.MiscDesc: Increase the difficulty of checks to detect the ship with sensors by two.
Upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks once against the ship at Short range or further.
Add setback to combat checks targetting ship at Short range or further

ItemAttachments.Name: Gunnery Droid Brain
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Gunnery Droid Brain[h3]
Much more than a simiple targeting computer, a specialized droid brain can be installed on a ship to operate its weapons indepedantly or assist a sentient gunner. Although GoCorp's CD-14c model continues to prove popular with Technicians who want their ship to defend itself when necessary, some users complain of the droid's overly hostile antagonistic behaviour. GoCorp continues to deny rumours of so-called "unanticipated activations". This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] GoCorp's CD-14c

Mod.MiscDesc: Add a droid brain with Gunnery 2 and Agility 0.
Increase the droid brain's Gunnery skill by 1

ItemAttachments.Name: Laser Focusing Array
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Laser Focusing Array[h3]
Laser cannons are the mainstay weapons of many ships, and manufacturers constantly compete to outdo each other in their products' power, accuracy, and rate of fire. As well as consistently bringing new models to market, some manufacturers produce aftermarket upgrades to improve performance. Of course, many Technicians find their own ways to improve weapons systems through - often dangerous - tinkering, This attachment can be applied to any starship.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Taim & BAck G-1 Enchanced Laser Focusing Array, Loronar Corporations Mk III Optimized Galven Coils

Mod.MiscDesc: Add automatic [AD] to combat checks made with the ship's laser cannons and turbolasers.

ItemAttachments.Name: Encrypted Computer
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Encrypted Computer[h3]
A skilled Slicer knows how to protect a computer system from others skilled in electronic skulduggery, and is likeley to take steps to do just that. Whether consisting of modifications and programming by a crew member or of specialized softwar purchased on teh black market, encrypted systems can protect a ship agains slicing attacks at port and during battle. In addition to preventing catastrophes during skirmishes, the extra security is of great use to any group that wants to keep its data private. This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship.
[B][P]Models Include:[b] Numerous Custom Variants

Mod.MiscDesc: Upgrade difficulty of all Computers checks made to slice the ship's computer system once.
Add setback to Computers checks made to slice the ship's computer systems

ItemAttachments.Name: Enhanced Repulsorlift
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Enhanced Repulsorlift[h3]
As one might well guess from their name, speeders are swift craft by nature. For some pilots, however, there is no such thing as a enough speed. Enhancements and modifications to repulsorlift systems can often coax extra acceleration out of factory-standard models, despite the fact that manufacturers caution against making such dangerous customizations to their vehivles. The attachment can be applied to any airspeeder or landspeeder.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Ubikkian Transports Ultralift 2000

ItemAttachments.Name: Amphibious Modification
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Amphibious Modification[h3]
Most starships, speeders and other vehicles not specifically designed for it are unfit for usage underwater. Starships are typically not hydrodynamic, and hills designed for zero gravity and atmospheric use can suffer damage from deep-sea pressure. However, with the addition of turbines, moidifications to the engines and reinforcement of the structure  almost any vehicle can be made seaworthy. This attachment can be applied to any vehicle or starship that can enter an atmosphere.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various Custom Models

Mod.MiscDesc: Vehicle can operate underwater without penalty.

ItemAttachments.Name: Decoy Buoy
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Decoy Buoy[h3]
A favourite of scoundrels and pirates, decoy buoys are oftern devices cobbled together from salvaged parts, including transponders and comm systems. Although it might visually resemble nothing so much as a cylinder - or amalgamation of scrap parts - a meter or so across, a well constructed decoy buot transmits a transponder signal, emits ion streams and outputs other data and signals associated with starships. This attachment can be applied to any starship.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Numerous custom variants

Mod.MiscDesc: Buoy may be jettisoned as an action.
Buoy can be programmed with a specific transponder code with a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b].
Buoy can be set to transmit a distress signal or other data.
A character operating ship sensors must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to identify that the buoy is not an actual ship.
After being jettisoned, buoy no longer counts as being attached to the ship until it is reattached.
Add setback to Computers checks to identify the buoy

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-15) Sublight Boost Thrusters
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Sublight Boost Thrusters for AD-15[h3]
The craft's engines can be equipped with sublight boosters which considerably increase their output. Flying at higher speeds also makes the vehicle harder to handle in rough conditions such as asteroid fields, but when outrunning a patrol boat or pirate vessel, it can be the difference between life and death.
[P][H4]<font size=1>Please see page 63 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.</font>[h4]

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-15) Hyperdrive Class 4 Module
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Hyperdrive Class 4 Module for AD-15[h3]
Installing a hyperdrive, even a relatively low-grade one, in an AD-15 takes up a good deal of space inside of the craft, but also allows it to operate independently. Fo many mercenaries, bounty hunters and other frequent travelers, such an upgrade is well worth the cost.
[P][H4]<font size=1>Please see page 63 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.</font>[h4]

Mod.MiscDesc: Add astromech droid socket.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-15) Shield Generator Module
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Shield Generator Module  forAD-15[h3]
Many fightercradt lack shields, including most of the Galactic Empire's TIE Series. Of course, many pilots view going into battle without shields as a sure sign of a death wish, Soldiers of fortune and others who fight for credits rather than ideology tend to prefer the thought of living to get paid to the prospect of dying gloriously for some intagible ideal, and so the highly customizable AD-15 can be fitted with shield generators to improve its durability.
[P][H4]<font size=1>Please see page 63 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.</font>[h4]

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-15) Fine-Tuned Microthrusters
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Fine-Tuned Microthrusters for AD-15[h3]
The AD-15 is already a relatively maneuverable craft, but installing and personalizing an array of small vectors adjustments thrusters allows it to complete with many of the galaxy's nimblest starfighters.
[P][H4]<font size=1>Please see page 63 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.</font>[h4]

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-15) Hyperdrive Class 8 Module
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Hyperdrive Class 8 Module for AD-15[h3]
Installing a hyperdrive, even a relatively low-grade one, in an AD-15 takes up a good deal of space inside of the craft, but also allows it to operate independently. Fo many mercenaries, bounty hunters and other frequent travelers, such an upgrade is well worth the cost.
[P][H4]<font size=1>Please see page 63 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.</font>[h4]

Mod.MiscDesc: Add astromech droid socket.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-15) Cargo Pod
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Cargo Pod for AD-15[h3]
The cargo pods for this cradt are large, cylindrical affairs, designed for efficiency, not aesthetics. These pods can even be retrofitted to carry passengers, though they do not make for comfortable quarters.
[P][H4]<font size=1>Please see page 62 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.</font>[h4]

ItemAttachments.Name: All-Terrain Legs
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]All-Terrain Legs[h3]
Although ion drives and repulsorlifts dominate the galaxy, the continued use of walkers by the Empire and certain planetary militias is testament tot eh advantages of such craft. Walkers are stable, implacable and usually intimidating. For those who want true versatility from their craft, speeders and eve starships can be modified with the addition of a number, depending on the size and shape of the vehicle, of sturdy mechanical legs. In some cases, these might be mistaken for simple landing gear - until the vehivle begins to stomp forward. This attachment can be applied to any airspeeder or starship that can land on a planet.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Kuat Drive Yards KR-2 "Crab" Auxiliary Locomotion Unit, Alto Industries Variable Combat Kit

Mod.MiscDesc: As a maneuver, pilot may shift in or out of walker mode.  In walker mode, pilot uses Piloting (Planetary) and speed is reduced to 2.
Remove setback from Piloting (Planetary) checks due to difficult terrain
Remove setback from Gunnery checks due to cover or terrain

ItemAttachments.Name: Radiation Shielding
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Radiation Shielding[h3]
The galaxy contains many perils, but one of the most common is radiation. From the depths of space to polluted industrial zones, radiation hazards both natural and artificial are a frequent threat to spacers. Although spacesuits provide a degree of protection and specialiszed hazard suits are available, some individuals prefer to also be protected from blaster bolts and blades. A variety of polymers, reflective coatings, and energy dampeners can be fitted or applied to armour to provide protection from radiation. This attachment can only be applied to laminate armor, heavy battle armor, and any other armor that can be fully sealed.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Loronar Model 4 Hostile Environment Treatment, Neuro-Saav Radiological Hazard Shielding.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BO][BO] to Resilience checks to resist radiation.
Increase armor's soak by 1 against damage caused by radiation

ItemAttachments.Name: Reinforced Gauntlets
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Reinforced Gauntlets[h3]
Additional armor plating on the hands is a valuable upgrade for those who gavour heavier armor, as well as those who do welding jobs on starships and desire to keep all of their fingers. Not only does such extra plating provide additional protection, but it ensures that the wearer is never unarmed; after all, the guantles are heavy enough to shatter bones when used to deliver a punch. It also helps protect the user's hands in case they are ever stuck closing a blast door or shocked by a loose wireing while performing battlefield repairs. This attachment can be applied to any  armor with soak 2 or higher.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various models

Mod.MiscDesc: May use gauntlets as a melee weapon.

ItemAttachments.Name: Integrated Slicer Gear
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Integrated Slicer Gear[h3]
Slicers must often conduct their work under strict time constraints and less than ideal conditions. By integrating a customized computer, dataports and gesture interface circuitry into worn armour, a slicer can ensure that the tools of the trade are always at hand and almost impossible to lose. A visor-mounted heads-up display or holographic image streams the data the slicer needs, while specially designed gloves or guantlets allow the slicer to manipulate code using nothing more than gestures and brief voice commands. This attachment can be applied to any armor.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] MerenData Mobile XR-1, numerous custom variants

Mod.MiscDesc: Counts as having Slicer Gear.  Can be controlled by gesture or voice.

ItemAttachments.Name: Ion Shielding
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Ion Shielding[h3]
Rarely encountered in doby armor and more commonly (and usually illegally) applied directly to droid shssis, ion shielding provides protection agains ionization blasters. Although the mitigation it grants is far from complete, the energy-dampening effects can keep a droid operational where it would otherwise be shutdown. This attachment can be applied to any armor with soak 2 or higher.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Outlaw Tech Ion Shielding, Industrial Automaton Mk. III Ion Guard

Mod.MiscDesc: Increase soak by 3 against weapons with Ion quality.
Increase ranged and melee defense by 1 against weapons with Ion quality

ItemAttachments.Name: Custom Fit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Custom Fit[h3]
Although standard "off-the-shelf" armor can provide invaluable protection, it can also prove bulky or awkward, even adter adjustments. For those who require their armor to feel like a second skin, personalized customization can make a drastic difference. Such  work requires a skilled armorer, but it can make body armor a much more enticing option for some. This attachment can be applied to any armor.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Numerous variants

Mod.MiscDesc: Removes [SE] from Athletics and Stealth checks.
Remove an additional setback from Athletics and Stealth checks

ItemAttachments.Name: Integrated Ascension Gear
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Integrated Ascension Gear[h3]
Incorporating a grapnel launcer, line, clips and other climbing and rappelling equipment directly into a set of armor ensures that the user is always prepared to ascend or descend sheer surfaces in a hurry. Whether to escape from pursuers, follow a target, infiltrate a secure building or exfiltrate from a dangerous situation, ascension gear  can prove invaluable in a variety of situations. In addition, having the grapnel and line integrated directly into one's armor provides a high degree of safety and security. This attachment can be applied to any armor.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] TaggeCo Integrated Ascension Unit, VargeCorp ClimbAll Armor.

Mod.MiscDesc: As an action, may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check[b] to secure grappling hook to an object within medium range and reel in cord.
May pull another character aloft by making an [B]Easy ([DI]) Athletics check[b].

ItemAttachments.Name: Vibro-Bayonet
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Vibro-Bayonet[h3]
Although most fights are resolved with exchanges of blaster fire, a close-range firefight can quickly turn into a melee. When this happens, it pays to be prepared. Because the time it takes to draw a blade can mean the difference between life and death, some spacers equip their blasters with vibro-bayonets, essentially vibroblades mounted on the barrel of a gun. While a vibro-spear is not many Technicians' weapon of choice, having one at hand is considerably better than being effectively unarmed when combat takes place in such cramped quarters as teh belly of a starship. This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Heavy) weapon that could be logically mount a bayonet.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Czerka Arms "Last Resort" Vibro-Bayonet, Merr-Sonn Model 3 Combat Attachment

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds a vibro-bayonet to the weapon

ItemAttachments.Name: Amphibious Modification
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Amphibious Modification[h3]
Many worlds are covered in cast oceans and no few species have evolved in aquatic environments. Forthose sentients without the evolutionary adaptation of gills, specialized equipment is necessary. With the addition of a sealed helmet and oxygen (or other appropriate gas) supply, nearly any suit of armor can be converted into an amphibious suit. Retractable flippers provide humanoids with improved mobility in water and other liquids. This attachment can be applied to any armor that could logically have an air tank attached.
[P][B]Models Include:[b]Gandorthal Atmospherics Submerible 9, BioTech Mk. II Air Supply

Mod.MiscDesc: Provides up to five hours of oxegen in submersive or airless environments.  Does not protect against vacuum.
Removes [SE] from physical checks due to underwater conditions.
Increase oxegen supply by two hours

ItemAttachments.Name: Stripped Down
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Stripped Down[h3]
By removing redundant components and stripping down the body, it is possible to significantly reduce the weight and profile of a blaster or other weapon. A weapon modified this way is more easily carried and transtported and can be better hidden under a coat or among other equipment. THe attachment can be used with any Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] None

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [SE] to Perception checks to find the weapon when hidden.

ItemAttachments.Name: Under-Barrel Grapnel Launcher
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Under-Barrel Grapnel Launcher[h3]
Often seen among mercenary and special operations forces, an under-barrel grapnel launcher provides a quick way to scale sheer surfaces in the midst of a combat situation or during a covert infiltration. A durasteel hook, possibly with a mono-molecular point, can find purchase on nearly any surface, while a spool of synthrope or liquid cable provides up to 100 meters of length. A powerful motor automatically retracts the cable, pulling the user up - though holding onto any passengers who are along for the ride is a more difficult matter, and requires some effort on part of the user. This attachment can be used with any Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) weapons that could logically have a grapnel launcher mounted on it.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Merr-Sonn KR-2 Auxiliary Grapnel, TaggeCo "Skysailer" Grapnel Launcher

Mod.MiscDesc: As an action, may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Ranged (Light) check[b] to secure grappling hook to an object within medium range and reel in cord.
May pull another character aloft by making an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Athletics check[b].

ItemAttachments.Name: Secondary Ion Blaster
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Secondary Ion Blaster[h3]
A secondary ion blaster provides an extra level of offense for those expecting run-ins with droids. Many Technicians prefer to take enemy droids intact, the better to "recruite" them or even scavenge for parts later. An ion blaster mounted alongside another weapon provides just that option. This attachment can be used with any Ranged (Heavy) weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] SoroSuub Droid Defender, BlasTech Model 9 Under-Barrel Ion Blaster

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds an ion blaster to the weapon.

ItemAttachments.Name: Sonic Scope
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Sonic Scope[h3]
Originally developed to overcome personal cloaking devices and other sensor-baffling defences, a sonic scope uses ultrasonic sound waves to detect a target and generate a visual representation. With proper calibration, the sonar waves can be set to pass through even duracrete and other solid surfaces. This attachment can be used with any Ranged (Heavy) weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] CryonCorp PL-1 "Second Sight" Scope, SoroSuub Model Z Integrated Sonar System

Mod.MiscDesc: May observe and target enemies who are completely hidden by solid objects.

ItemAttachments.Name: Rapid-Recharge XCiter
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Rapid-Recharge XCiter[h3]
Speciffically modified gas conversion enablers can allow a blaster pistol or rifle to achieve much higher rates of fire than those of a true repeating blaster. Along with modifying or replacing the XCiter, and potentially the blaster actuating module. Technicians making heavy modifications to a blaster also often modify the trigger to allow for fully automatic fire when the user keeps it depressed. Such high rates of fire mean a considerable loss in accuracy. Nevertheless, the advantages offered by a rapid-fire weapon outweigh these drawbacks for some users. This attachment can be applied to any blaster.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] BlasTech XCelerator, SoroSuub M-3 Recycling Module, various custom models.

ItemAttachments.Name: Removed Safety Features
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Removed Safety Features[h3]
By removing or deactivating weapon safeties and other features a gun can more easily be drawn and readied for combat. Of course, these safety features are in place for a reason, and weaponsn modified in such a way tend to be more accident prone. This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Light) or Ranged (Heavy) weapon that could logically have such elements to remove.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] None

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [BO] to first combat check during an encounter.
GM may spend [TH][TH] to cause misfire.  Weapon runs out of ammo and inflicts 4 strain on wielder.

ItemAttachments.Name: Optimized Energy Cell
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Optimized Energy Cell[h3]
An optimized energy cell or expanded gas reserve allows a blaster to achieve a much higher number of shots before needing to reload, thanks to more efficent use of resources. Such modifications are often the result of excessive tinkering, rather than off-the-shelf models. This attachmentcan be applied to any energy weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[p] Czerka Arms Model 4 Expanded Gas Reservoir, Blastech X-3 Extended Energy Cell

Mod.MiscDesc: When GM spends [DE] or [TH] to cause the weapon to run out of ammo, it requires an additional [TH].

ItemAttachments.Name: Overcharged Actuating Module
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Overcharged Actuating Module[h3]
An overcharged blaster actuating module provies for a more powerful shot at the cost of a greater use of gas as well as increased wear and tear on the weapon. For some spacers, these drawbacks are woth the extra firepower. Although some kits are available for purchase many Technicians achieve the same result by scavenging parts from higher yield blaster. This attachment can be applied to any blaster pistol or carbine.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] BlasTech Mk. II Actuating Module, SoroSuub BlastPro

Mod.MiscDesc: GM may spend [TH][TH] to damage weapon by one step.

ItemAttachments.Name: Gyrostabilizer
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Gyrostabilizer[h3]
A gyrostabilizer, or repulsorlift harness, artificially reduces the weight of  the weapon, allowing a user to heft and aim a heavy weapon with decreased difficulty. With such a modification, a single combatant can operate a weapon that normally requires a team of two. These sophisticated devices are comparatively expensive and rare, and thus are seldom seen outside of elite forces. This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery Weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] TaggeCo Type 2 Repulsorlift Harness, BlasTech Mk. IV Gyrostabilization Unit

ItemAttachments.Name: Integrated Scanner
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Integrated Scanner[h3]
A scanner incorporated into a weapon allows the user to keep a rifle readied while constantly monitoring the surrounding area for danger. Specialized units might detect life signs, movement, or the energy cells of weapons. The battlefield awareness added by such a device can make the difference between victory and defeat. This attachment can be applied to any Ranged (Heavy) weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Carbanti United Electronics Mk. II Omni-Scope, CryonCorp "Heads-Up" Scanner Suite

Mod.MiscDesc: Weapon incorporates a general-purpose scanner.
Wielder adds automatic [AD][AD] to Initiative checks while weapon is drawn.
Remove 1 setback die from Initiative checks

ItemAttachments.Name: Custom Grip
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Custom Grip[h3]
A skilled tinkerer can tailor a weapon to perfectly fit its weilder's hand. A custom grip is cradted to uniquely match its owner, allowing the weapon to act as an extension of the wielder's body. While the weapon fits perfectly in the hands of its owner, others who try to use it find the grip uncomfortable or the weapon off-balance. A finely customized frip is the hallmark of a master weaponsmith. This attachment can be applied to any weapon with a handle.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] None

Mod.MiscDesc: Anyone other than owner adds [SE][SE] to combat checks using this weapon.

ItemAttachments.Name: Enhanced XCiter
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Enhanced XCiter[h3]
Outlaw Techs have long known how to modify the gas conversion enabler in a blaster to yield a more highly energetic - correspondingly more destructive - payload. Such modified XCiter modules are highly unstable, however, and are sometimes disparaged as being just as dengerous to the wielder and anyone else nearby as to the enemy. Despite the risk and the illegality of the modification, many outlaws seek out such customizations to gain the edge in a firefight. This attachment can be applied to any blaster.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Outlaw Tech Custom XCiter
[P][H4]<font size=1>Please see page 54 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.</font>[h4].

Mod.MiscDesc: GM may spend [DE][DE] to cause blaster to explode, destroying blaster and inflicting automatic Critical Injury on wielder.

ItemAttachments.Name: Top-Loading Magazine
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Top-Loading Magazine[h3]
By switching out the standard single-bolt loading system for a cobbled-together "magazine" containing numerous bolts, a skilled craftsmperson can increase the number of rivets the gun can place per minute dramatically. Some use this to apply rivets more rapidly to other sentient beings, though all manufacturers consider this to be "user error".

ItemAttachments.Name: Shaped Nozzle
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Shaped Nozzle[h3]
By adding a metal cone to an ion thruster, a Technician can dramatically increase its potency as a weapon, focusing the energy into a sharp beam rather than letting it disperse in a wide arc.

ItemAttachments.Name: Pressurized Gas Cartridge
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Pressurized Gas Cartridge[h3]
While a spray injector does not typically expel its contents with sufficient force to inflict serious harm, there is no particular reason it cannot do so if a tinkerer is willing to change out the factory-standard gas cartridge for one with a bit more kick. Needless to say, making such an alteration voids the multi-goo gun's warranty.

ItemAttachments.Name: Balanced Barrel
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Balanced Barrel[h3]
Adding a functional barrel to a rivet gun can give it dramatically more range and accuracy as a shooting weapon. Of course, such an addition also makes it obvious that the device is liable to be fired at range, as few Technicians can make a coherent case that they legitimately need to be able to bolt hull plates onto a ship with pinpoint accuracy at a distance of severy meters.

ItemAttachments.Name: Self-Repair Systems
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Self-Repair Systems[h3]
Some sentients on the fringes of galactic civilization live a life of near-sonstant battle. For such individuals, a good suit of armor is vital, and keeping it in top condition is nearly as important. Some suits of armor include sophisticated self-repair suites, not dissimilar to the systems found in some droids. Smart materials, laminate extruders, electromagnetic assemblers and other systems work to keep the armor in one piece even under the greatest duress. This attachment can be applied to any armor with melee or ranged defense 1 or higher.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] INdustrial Automato Model 3 Autorepair Suite, AccuTronics Advanced Repair Unit

Mod.MiscDesc: Once per encounter as a maneuver, can have armor attempt to repair itself or assist in a repair.  Counts as Intellect 2 and Mechanics 2 ([PR][PR]).
There is no cost to repair armor, whether using the automatic feature, or personally repairing.

ItemAttachments.Name: Holo-Tank
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Holo-Tank[h3]
“Holo-tank” is a catchall term for a type of holoprojection
system used aboard starships and in military facilities.
Produced by a number of technology firms, holotanks
are large, circular holoprojectors mounted in
decks or floors, typically in the center of large command
centers. Real-time tactical data from friendly forces is
fed directly to the holo-tank, where it creates a threedimensional
model of a battle that can be observed
at various magnifications. Holo-tanks are instrumental
in planning and executing large-scale military actions.
When paired with proper tactical data networks, they
provide unparalleled battlespace awareness.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Imlok Technologies ARENA-2500,
Brosso Mk. IX Tactical holoprojector, Chedak Communications
“Omni-View" LS-220 holo-tank.

Mod.MiscDesc: Characters utilizing a holo-tank may always use Cool or Knowledge (Warfare)  when making Initiative checks.
Add one advantage to Mass Combat checks when acting force commander is on board this ship
Upgrade the ability of checks when determining Initiative once

ItemAttachments.Name: Tactical Command, Control, and Communications Suite
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Tactical Command, Control, and Communications Suite[h3]
Mounted to ships and vehicles piloted by designated
squadron leaders, the TC3 suite allows the sharing
of data and sensor telemetry between networked
ships or vehicles. Built for use mainly in tanks, walkers,
airspeeders, and starfighters, TC3 suites facilitate
more efficient communications between members of
a squadron, and they provide the squadron leader
with a number of command and control options to
enhance the squadron’s performance.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various models.

Mod.MiscDesc: While active, a force commander in the vehicle upgrades the ability of all Mass Combat checks once
Allies benefiting from Situational Awareness remove one Setback on Perception and Vigilance checks

ItemAttachments.Name: Briefing Auditorium
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Briefing Auditorium[h3]
Most dedicated warships, especially those in service
with the Imperial Navy, have special compartments set
aside for the briefing and debriefing of fighter, gunboat,
and shuttle pilots, ground vehicle drivers, and ground
combat forces. Before and after missions, pilots, soldiers,
and support staff gather in these large, well-lit
compartments to be briefed on their missions by a
senior officer, or to report on their missions and learn
how their success or failure affected the larger strategic
situation. Typically located close to hangars, barracks,
or berth decks, a standard briefing auditorium features
plenty of seating, access to power and shipboard networks
for datapads, a lectern or speaking platform, and
audio/video/holo equipment. These rooms and equipment
allow senior officers to issue orders en masse and
to make sure that all of their subordinates are properly
prepared for the mission at hand.
[P]While the Alliance to Restore the Republic fields some
dedicated warships, either decommissioned vessels
from the Clone Wars or stolen Imperial Navy vessels,
most Alliance ships began life as civilian vessels and
were militarized in an ad hoc fashion to fit the needs
of specific Rebel cells or fleets. Ships of silhouette 5 or
larger can be fitted with a briefing auditorium, giving
Commanders a venue in which to issue orders personally
and en masse to the troops and pilots under their
command.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] None.

Mod.MiscDesc: Characters briefed in this auditorium prior to a mission remove [SE] due to known mission conditions from skill checks for the duration of the mission.
Add one Advantage to Leadership checks made by characters within the briefing auditorium

ItemAttachments.Name: Electronic Counter-Countermeasures Suite
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Theater Command and Control System[h3]
“Electronic counter-countermeasures” (ECCM) is
a catchall term for a number of techniques, such as
FAST ECM detection, frequency hopping, pulse compression,
and polarization filtering, used to prevent or
break comms and sensor jamming caused by enemy
electronic countermeasures. ECCM suites require large
amounts of energy and often reduce the effectiveness
of a ship or vehicle’s sensors. On smaller ships like
fighters and shuttles, as well as in ground vehicles and
airspeeders, ECCM suites are installed in line with the
vehicle’s active sensors, and they can be activated or
deactivated quickly by the pilot or electronic systems
operator. On larger ships of gunship size or bigger,
ECCM suites are complex affairs composed of numerous
compartments and staffed by a dedicated crew.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Fabritech 830 “Stutterer” ECCM system,
Miradyne A5x.4 “Oracle” ECCM suite (starfighters
and shuttles only), KDY Advanced Capital ECCM suite
(gunships, cruisers, and battleships only).

Mod.MiscDesc: Make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] to cancel all effects of an electronic countermeasures suite.
Decrease difficulty of the Computers check by 1

ItemAttachments.Name: Theater Command and Control System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Theater Command and Control System[h3]
Fitted to ships or vehicles of silhouette 4 or larger, a
theater command and control system (TCCS) grants a
commanding officer and staff incredible control over
large-scale conflicts. Using a combination of sensor
telemetry, tactical data links, and banks of powerful
processors, a TCCS takes in and analyzes battlespace
data to provide Alliance commanders with all of the
data needed to make good strategic decisions in battle.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various models.

Mod.MiscDesc: While active, force commander on the bridge upgrades the ability of all Mass Combat checks twice
Gain an additional Advantage on Mass Combat checks
Remove one Setback from Mass Combat checks

ItemAttachments.Name: Storage Unit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Storage Unit[h3]
This empty module has a variety of
pockets and pouches designed to store survival gear,
spare blaster gas canisters, power packs, field rations,
and a variety of other pieces of equipm ent used by
the Rebel Alliance. This unit increases the wearer’s
encumbrance capacity by 3.

ItemAttachments.Name: Sensor Unit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Sensor Unit[h3]
This unit features a raised, rotating
dish not unlike the similar, smaller unit common to
astromech droids. The sensor feeds a wrist-mounted
touchscreen and can be set to alert a soldier to movement nearby, or scan the area in general up to long
range. In addition to receiving narrative benefits such
as advance warning of movement, the wearer adds automatic [AD] to Vigilance checks.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [AD] to Vigilance checks.

ItemAttachments.Name: Oxygen Unit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Oxygen Unit[h3]
This unit can provide an additional
twelve hours of oxygen when connected to any
rebreather, breath mask, or environmentally sealed suit

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds additional twelve hours of oxygen when connected to any rebreather, breath mask, or sealed suit.

ItemAttachments.Name: Power Unit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Power Unit[h3]
This portable power can recharge a
depleted piece of equipment as an action, or a droid
or larger piece of machinery in two hours. Once per encounter, it can allow the wearer of the backpack to
ignore an “out of ammo" [DE] result in the same manner
as an extra reload (see page 197 of the [B]Age of Rebellion[b] Core Rulebook).

Mod.MiscDesc: May recharge a depleted piece of equipment as an action, or a droid or larger piece of machinery in two hours.
Once per encounter, wearer may ignore an "out of ammo" [DE] result in the same manner as an Extra Reload.

ItemAttachments.Name: Comms Unit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Comms Unit[h3]
 This pack functions as a comms hub,
routing Alliance communications up to long range
on the planetary scale. Its encryption adds [SE][SE] to
checks made to unscramble the signal.

Mod.MiscDesc: May route communications up to long range on the planetary scale.
Adds [SE][SE] to checks made to unscramble the unit's signal.

ItemAttachments.Name: Galven Pattern Resequencing
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Galven Pattern Resequencing[h3]
Some Alliance operatives would gladly trade a little
reliability in exchange for the stopping power necessary to penetrate Imperial armor. This makes the Galven pattern resequencing a popular upgrade among
troops in service of the Rebellion. By focusing the Galven pattern into a tighter wavelength, more energy is
packed into each blaster bolt, which increases damage output. Unfortunately, the added workload on
the blaster’s tiny circuitry makes the weapon much
more prone to failure. This attachment can only be
used with blaster pistols and heavy blaster pistols.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds automatic [TH][TH] to all combat checks made using this weapon.

ItemAttachments.Name: Temperature Control Unit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Temperature Control Unit[h3]
This unit comes with
a specialized bodysuit that attaches to the module’s
cooling or heating system, removing up to [SE][SE] from
the user’s checks to resist extreme heat or cold.

Mod.MiscDesc: Removes up to [SE][SE] from checks to resist extreme heat or cold.

ItemAttachments.Name: Beam Splitter
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Beam Splitter[h3]
Alliance troopers typically apply this upgrade to
blaster pistols and other sidearms to achieve results
similar to that of the spread barrel used on larger,
more powerful blasters. Beam splitters function by
modifying the Galven pattern and carefully mounting
three or more em itters into a honeycomb configuration inside a stock blaster barrel. Shots fired from a
weapon with this modification diffuse into a weaker,
spread shot rather than the typical blaster bolt, giving a single shot the potential to connect with multiple targets. Rebel troops often use this upgrade to
transform weaponry into effective standoff weapons
used to pin down enemy troops and hold chokepoints
in narrow starship corridors. This attachment can be
applied to any blaster or suitable energy weapon that
does not have the Blast quality.

ItemAttachments.Name: Built-In Blaster Sight
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Built-In Blaster Sight[h3]
A typical modification used by the Rebellion’s SpecForce troops, this attachment allows a harmless beam
of energy to trickle out of the barrel on a half-trigger pull to "paint” the target, letting the wielder see
exactly where she is aiming Most models illuminate
beams in the human visual spectrum, but some use
light wavelengths invisible to the naked eye, which
require special goggles to spot, to ensure the agent's
position remains uncompromised. This attachment
can only be applied to energy ranged weapons.

Mod.MiscDesc: Remove [SE] added by the Called Shot use of the Aim maneuver from Ranged Light and Ranged Heavy checks.

ItemAttachments.Name: XV-09 Chemical Restraint Harness
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]XV-09 Chemical Restraint Harness[h3]
The XV-09 Pacifier is one of the more uncommon products sold by Xenovet. Roundly derided by those who
make their living with animals as a cheap shortcut used
by quacks and animal haters, the Pacifier is designed
to control a wild or otherwise uncontrollable animal
through chems rather than training. Similar to a typical
riding or restraining harness, the Pacifier is made of a
sturdy and flexible synthetic weave that loops around
a creature's ribs, chest, and shoulders with a heavy
brace that sits at its withers. Built into the back brace is
a refillable auto-hypo typically filled with a cocktail of
behavior-controlling drugs. The auto-hypo is connected to a remote that can trigger the pump at up to close
range, and is used in much the same way as a remote
for a droid restraining bolt. While the drugs tend to
make even the most cross-grained creature docile and
biddable, they can also have a number of unforeseen
side effects ranging from dulling a creature's intellect or
senses to killing it with an overdose.
[P]Using a Pacifier on a wild animal is a temporary fix at
best, and should only be done in emergencies. Mounting the harness on a creature requires a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Survival check[b] to ensure the harness is fitted properly
and the auto-hypo is situated correctly. The difficulty
of this check can be reduced by 1 with a successful
[B]Knowledge (Xenology) check[b]. If successful, the XV-09
grants [BO][BO] to any Survival checks made to control
the beast wearing the harness. In addition, creatures
that are successfully pacified gain [BO] to any Discipline
checks. Game Masters can spend any [TH] generated by
the initial Survival check to reflect one or more negative side effects caused by the drugs. The exact nature
of these side effects is left to the Game Master's discretion. In addition, the Game Master can spend [TH][TH][TH]
or [DE] to reflect a catastrophic reaction to the drugs,
such as a heart attack or brain aneurysm, which results
in the animal's death. While safe for use on animals, the
powerful mixture of chemicals in the harness can be
dangerous to the minds of sentient beings. Attaching
the harness to a sentient being can result in permanent
brain damage and even death.

Mod.MiscDesc: Pacified beasts gain [BOOST] to any [B]Displine Checks[b].

ItemAttachments.Name: Enhanced Hyperspace Shields
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Enhanced Hyperspace Shields[h3]
Few things are more dangerous to a ship than colliding with a mass shadow in hyperspace. Although all ships are equipped with sensors intended to detect a mass shadow and automatically drop the ship out of hyperspace, such systems are not infallible. As an added level of protection, some engineers modify a vessel with  enhanced particle shielfs designed to potentially save a ship from complete desctruction in a case of a hyperspace collision. Many captains consider the drain on ship resources and the cost to be too great for additional protection agains such a rare event, but these systems save lives. This attachment can be applied to any ship with a hyperdrive.

Mod.MiscDesc: Downgrade difficulty of Astrogation checks made to navigate the ship through hyperspace once.
Remove [SE] from Astrogation checks made to navigate the ship through hyperspace

ItemAttachments.Name: Podracer Engine
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Podracer Engine[h3]
Podracer engines come in three varieties rocket motors, turbine engines, and high-performance ion engines. In the early days of Podracing, engines were salvaged and reuilt by talented amateurs. Single-stage heavy lift rockets, ion engines from crashed starfighters, air breathign turbojets from performance irspeeders, and even more exotic engine types were hauled out of scrapyards or dug out of old military depots and put to use on the racing circuits. Today most Podracer engines are either hand-built custom jobs built by big racing teams to their own exact specifications or mass produced engines from one of the major manufacturers. No matter their provenance, they are all too big, too fast and too loud for civilized racing, which is what makes them so appealing for Podracers.
[P]Podracer engines must be installed in matched sets usually in multiples of two. Doing otherwise makes for a poorly balanced, finicky, unreliable Podracer that is  by its mismatched nature, even more dangerous than usual.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] TurboDyne 99-U, Manta RamAir Mk. IV Flat Twin Turbojet, JAK Racing J930 Dash-8, Radon-Ulzer 620C S&K JZ-5 Fusial Thrust Engine, Incom 2a Fission Engine.

ItemAttachments.Name: Podracer Shield Generator
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Podracer Shield Generator[h3]
Most Podracers, whether custom-built raceers or one of the many factory customs, mount a small, low-output shield generator in the cockpit. These shield generators are thin and cover primarily the very front. They only protect the driver, and only from exhaust wash from the engines and from debris kicked up from the track surface or flung at the racer by spectators (or other racers). They provide no protection to to the vehicle itself and are generally worthless in the event of a crash or other catastrophic event.
[P]Some racers, though, value personal safety over tradition, running powerful, full-spectrum shield generators that protect the entire vehicel. These are usually built specifically for Podracing and are tuned for the kinds of environments typically found on Podrace courses. Racing teams that are too poor or too old-fasioned to use factory-built generators still use salvaged units pulled from wrecked starfighters or emplacement shield generators.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Novaldex GA21 Shield Generator, Chempat CED8089Y Shields, Keizar-Volvec Mk VIII Safety Shield, BGRE "Bug Smasher" Shield.

ItemAttachments.Name: Podracer Control Cables
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Podracer Control Cables[h3]
If Podracing evolved from ancient beast-drawn chariot and cart racing, as many historians suppose, then control cables are analogous to a set of reins. These long, flexible durasteel cables tether a Podracer's powerful engines to its cockpit. Along with keeping the engines and the cockpit connected, they also house the wiring that connects the controls to the engines. Steelton produces most Podracer control cables, but smaller companies have cropped up lately in an attempt to take away some of its market share.
[P]Nearly all Podracers use control cables, only a few small-production outliers, such as FG 8T8-T and a handful of one-offs and prototypes, mount the engines directly to the cockpit via spars. Control cables are the most fragile part of a Podracer, as even the stoutest set can be snapped or sliced through. A Podracer who loses her control cables through accident or sabotage loses control over her vehicle and must either eject or ride the cockpit to a stop and hope she survives.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Steelton Perfect-Series control cables, Moriales Systems SC-4.x control tether.

ItemAttachments.Name: High-Output Repulsor Coils
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]High-Output Repulsor Coils[h3]
Basic Podracer cockpits come equipped with low-output repulsor coils of the kind typically found on repulsorsleds and speeder trucks. Considered a secondary system at best, and really only equipped to keep the Podracer at altitude when standing still or at low speeds, a racer's repulsor coils are rarely given a second thought. Savvy racers, or veterans with years of racing and building experience under their belts, know that a good repulsorlift engine can often mean the difference between first and last place, or finishing or crashing. Upgraded repulsor coils increase a Podracer's maximum altitude, allowing it to clear obstacles more easily and even hop over lower flying opponents.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Incom TX-2, Bespin Motors Ponrez/Arc Repulsorlift, Karydee KD49 Drive Unit.

ItemAttachments.Name: Reinforced Engine Cowlings
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Reinforced Engine Cowlings[h3]
Part of the thrill of Podracing is the near certainty of collisions, for many enthusiasts, a good race is measured by how many crashes occurred, not how fast the winner ran the circuit. Given the nature of these races, many pilots view it as foregone that they will be involved in collisions, no matter what effort they might take to avoid them. This leads to some adopting reinforced plating for their engines, the better to withstand "accidental" impacts as they occur during a race.
[P]More tactically-minded pilots take this even further adding ridges, struts, and vanes designed to appear ornamental or to a aid in aerodynamics, but instead intended to cushion impacts when their vehicle rams into another. That those pilots who are frequently involved in collisions and still manage to cheat death race after race, garner large amounts of fame (and credits) certainly has a strong bearing on other pilots decision to adopt such modifications and alter their racing tactics accordingly.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various Models.

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduce Critical Hit result from collision by 20
Reduce Critical Hit result from collision by 20

ItemAttachments.Name: Foreign Debris Ejector
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Foreign Debris Ejector[h3]
Podracing attracts a wide range of pilots, from those who delight in testing their skill against fellow speed enthusists to those who are only interested in winning, no matter what it takes. For the latter, one method is not to boost their own vehicles performance but to instead hamper their opponants Podracers. Using concealed compartments (known more informally as "dirty trick kits"), pilots can release small nails, reactive chemicals or other debris-designed to foul the engines of a training vehicle, slowing it down or even knocking it out of the running. Though illegal, when used out of the sight of officials these compartments can decide the fate of many a race.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various (pilots and their crew typically craft them secretly).

Mod.MiscDesc: Ejects debris into the air behind podracer.  Any racer within close range and behind must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Piloting (Planetary) check[b] to avoid debris.  Failure reduces speed by 1 for 2 rounds, plus 1 round per [TH].  [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] can inflict Critical Hit on target vehicle.
May only be used once per race.

ItemAttachments.Name: Handling Upgrades
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Handling Upgrades[h3]
Podracer handling upgrades encompass a wide array of systems and technologies designed to make Podracers easier to pilot. These upgrades can be tiny, variable pitch jets and movable repulsor fields to brute force counterweights that slide into special compartments to counteract intertia. While such upgrades do increase a Podracer's handling capabilities, no amount of modification is likely to likely to make the exceedingly fast and fragile race vehicle easy enough to handle for a human pilot.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Incom ETX Mk. I Etheric Rudder, Slayn & Korpil Vitus-Series Attitude Thrusters, Bespid Motors PinPoint II Targeted Repulsor Generator.

ItemAttachments.Name: Podracer Ejection System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Podracer Ejection System[h3]
This is a simple pilot's ejection seat, commonly found in starfighters and combat airspeeders. When activated, either by the pilot or by a dead man's switch, should the pilot become incapacitated, the seat and pilot are launched from the Podracer's cockpit by small, high-output, single-use ion engines. Once the seat reaches a pre-set altitude, it deploys a parachute or activates a small repulsorlift generator, which returns the pilot swiftly and generally, safely to the ground.
