Few Podracer pilots equip their vehicles with ejection systems, however, as most consider the added weight and complexity of the system no worth the small gain in safety.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Income ACE Ejection Seat, Koensayr Np-K36 Ejection Seat, Sienar Fleet Systems Mk GT8 Deluxe Ejection Pod.

Mod.MiscDesc: To eject, make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Piloting (Planetary) check[b] as an out-of-turn incidental.  On success, pilot is ejected unharmed.  On failure, pilot suffers vehicle speed in strain, plus one Critical Injury.  GM can spend [TH][TH] or [DE] to cause wounds to be suffered instead.

ItemAttachments.Name: Collision Avoidance System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Collision Avoidance System[h3]
Due to their speed and the primative nature of their handling systems, Podracers are notoriously difficult to control. While a Podracer is blindingly fast in a straight line, getting one around corners with any accuracy or reliability is almost impossible, making crashes a common sight at races. As a result, many pilots equip their Podracers with collision avoidance systems to reduce the risk of crashes. While common collision avoidance systems are often barred from use in race series and are frowned upon by veteran racers, who consider them "electronic nannies".
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Aratech 8pz-X Constant Active Array, Fabritech "Co-Pilot" Adaptave Anti-Collision System, SoroSuub LX-19 Automatic Spot Thrusters.

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduce silhouette by 1 for purposes of determining difficulty of Piloting checks.

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Cloud Car
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Cloud Car[h3]
Converts a cloud car to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds a forward light auto-blaster

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Airspeeder
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Airspeeder[h3]
      Converts an airspeeder to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds a forward light blaster cannon

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Speeder Bike/Swoop
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Speeder Bike/Swoop[h3]
      Converts a speeder bike or swoop to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds a forward light repeating blaster

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Wheeled/Tracked
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Wheeled/Tracked[h3]
      Converts a wheeled or tracked vehicle to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds a medium laser cannon turret

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Medium Transport
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Medium Transport[h3]
      Converts a medium transport to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds two medium laser cannon turrets

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Light Freighter
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Light Freighter[h3]
      Converts a light freighter to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds two quad laser cannon turrets

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Shuttle
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Shuttle[h3]
      Converts a shuttle to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds two twin light laser cannon turrets

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Bulk Transport
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Bulk Transport[h3]
      Converts a bulk transport to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds two heavy laser cannon turrets

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Yacht
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Yacht[h3]
      Converts a yacht to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds two forward light laser cannons and one aft light laser cannon

ItemAttachments.Name: Etaan Crystal
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Etaan Crystal[h3]
These unusual kyber crystals from in the deep caverns of the Mid Rim world of Etai. Given that the crystals rarely form fewer than five hundred meters below the surface and usually at over twice the depth, the formation can be extremely difficult to locate. However, the raw crystals echo any nearby sound with a humming resonance, guiding searchers who draw near.
[P]Harvested etaan crystals retain this resonant property causing the activated blades of lightsabers using them to thrum in harmony with the motion of the blade, and to chime at nearby sounds. The blades resond especially spectacularly to a clash with another lightsaber or blaster bolt, emitting a near-deafening crack and a bright flare of energies. A clash of blades involving etaan crystals usually results in the lightsabers being forced apart, but reflected blasted bolts draw in the resonant energies from the reaction and intensify on their new trajectory.

Mod.MiscDesc: If wielder uses the Improved Reflect talent to inflict an automatic hit, increase damage by 2.

ItemAttachments.Name: Ghostfire Crystal
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Ghostfire Crystal[h3]
These kyber crystals grow in nearly invisible formations on a handful of far flung Outer Rim worlds. Their precarious spires of entirely tansparent stones rise from rocky foundations. They are typically found at the peaks of mountains, when they can be located at all. Finders can use ghostfire crystals to constuct a lightsaber with a blade as difficult to detect as the spire from which they harvested the crystal. Lightsabers with ghostfire crystals at their core produce no sound whatsoever, and the blades are dim and translucent compared to the incandescent fire of the other lightsabers. most curious of all are the illusory afterimages of the blades that follow the wielders' motions, disorienting foes and disguising the true position of their blades.

Mod.MiscDesc: Wielder may spend [AD][AD][AD][AD] or [TR] to prevent the target from using the Parry talent to reduce damage from this attack.

ItemAttachments.Name: Reflex Grip
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Reflex Grip[h3]
Through a delicate system of motion sensors and miniaturized motors built into a lightsaber hilt, a craftsperson can alter the lightsaber to respond to adjustments in grip and postion with greater responsiveness. The split-second edge granted by this sytem allows a combatant to more easily parry an opponent's decisive stroke or block each of a hail of blaster bolts. Controlling the system and keeping it from overreacting to minute or inadvertent motions can be difficult to master, but the defensive advantage of a reflex grip can be worth the extra practice.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] None; users must custom make each lightsaber attachment.

Mod.MiscDesc: When lightsaber is used to Parry or Reflect, suffer 1 additional strain, but count Parry and Reflect ranks as 1 higher.

ItemAttachments.Name: Shien Reverse Grip Customization
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Shien Reverse Grip Customization[h3]
Practitioners of Form V sometimes use a reverse grip on their lightsabers to assist in many of the techniques common to that form. Through a few careful adjustments to the grip and balance of their lightsabers, these practictioners can make the weapons more suited to wielding in this manner although the modifications make using a traditional grip somewhat unwieldly in the process.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] None; users must custom make each lightsaber attachment.

Mod.MiscDesc: Wielder adds [AD] to all Lightsaber (Cunning) checks, but adds [TH] to all other Lightsaber checks.

ItemAttachments.Name: Overcharged Power Cell
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Overcharged Power Cell[h3]
Lightsabers are exceptionally efficient weapons, able to run nearly forever off a single basic power cell, thanks to the remarkable focus of the kyber crystal installed within and the contained energy loop of the blade. As such, tampering with a lightsaber's power cell and adjusting its output usually does more harm than good, as it upsets the balance of a near-perfect system. Those who know what they are doing can sometimes overcharge the power cell of a lightsaber to increase the power fo teh blade, but these changes make the power cell volatile, prone to causing unpredictable fluctuations in the lightsaber's effects. When installed correctly, the effect of an overcharged power cell is more often beneficial than it is a hindrance, but the mere possibility of the blade dimming at the wrong moment dissuades some tinkerers from taking the risk.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] None; users must custom make each lightsaber attachment.

Mod.MiscDesc: Wielder can spend [AD] from combat checks to increase damage by 1.  GM can spend [TH][TH] to decrease damage by 1.

ItemAttachments.Name: Pistol Hilt
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Pistol Hilt[h3]
While the Jedi of old disdained blasters, modern Force users often need every advantage they can get. By adding a customized secondary emitter to a lightsaber hilt, the wielder can release the energies of her weapon at a distance in a manner similar to that of a blaster bolt. Without the focused field produced by a regular lightsaber emitter, the beam repidly loses coherency and stopping power, producing only a short-range stun bolt. A lightsaber used in this manner, though might not even be recognized for what it is, appearing to be an unusal or custom model of pistol instead of one of the legendary weapons of the Jedi. This additional layer of cover could mean as much protection as the new capabilities of the weapon.
[P]The user must spend a maneuver to switch from one weapon mode to the other lightsaber function to pistol function, for exmple.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] None; users must custom make each lightsaber attachment.

Mod.MiscDesc: Includes a built-in blaster pistol.

ItemAttachments.Name: Riding Tack
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Riding Tack[h3]
Riding tack is a catchall term for the assorted bits of equipment needed to ride or control a beast. Produced by comopanies like Piccatech Ltd. and VeTech, tack comes in a variety of styles tailored to the physiology of nearly every known domesicable beast in the galaxy. Riding tack includes a sturdy comfortable saddle designed for a specific beast and riding style, stirrups, headgear (bridle, halter, bit, reins, etc,), and a breastplate. Tack made for working animals replaces the saddle with a heavy duty harness that allows a creature to pull cargo sleds or implements such as plows.
[P]Tack can only be worn by riding or working animals. Using tack allows a character to ride the beast without suffering the bareback riding penalties detailed on page 73.

Mod.MiscDesc: Characters may ride beast without suffering bareback riding penalties.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-1S) Shield Generator Module
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Shield Generator Module  forAD-1S[h3]
Many fightercraft lack
shields, including most of the Galactic Empire's TIE
series. Of course, many pilots view going into battle
without shields as a sure sign of a death wish. Soldiers
of fortune and others who fight for credits rather than
ideology tend to prefer the thought of living to get paid
to the prospect of dying gloriously for some intangible
ideal, and so the highly customizable AD-1 S can be
fitted with shield generators to improve its durability.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-1S) Hyperdrive Class 8 Module
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Hyperdrive Class 8 Module for AD-1S[h3]
Installing a hyperdrive, even
a relatively low-grade one, in an AD-IS takes up a
good deal of space inside of the craft, but also allows
it to operate independently. For many mercenaries,
bounty hunters, and other frequent travelers, such an
upgrade is well worth the cost.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add astromech droid socket.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-1S) Cargo Pod
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Cargo Pod for AD-1S[h3]
The cargo pods for this craft are large, cylindrical affairs, designed for efficiency, not aesthetics. These pods can even be retrofitted to carry passengers, though they do not make for comfortable quarters.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-1S) Fine-Tuned Microthrusters
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Fine-Tuned Microthrusters for AD-1S[h3]
The AD-1 S is already a relatively maneuverable craft, but installing and personalizing an array of small vector adjustment thrusters allows it to compete with many of the galaxy's nimblest starfighters.

ItemAttachments.Name: Slugthrower Suppressor
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Slugthrower Suppressor[h3]
Suppressors are used by assassins and sharpshooters to make their weapons queiter and more difficult to detect when firing. Similar to energy dampers used to silence blasters, suppressors clip or screw onto the end of a weapon's barrel, redirecting sound and escaping gases to reduce the noise and muzzle flash a slugthrower produces when fired. While they don't make the weapon completely silent they do dramatically reduce its report, making a shooter more difficult to detect. The major downside of using a suppressor is that in reducing the weapon's report it also lowers the speed at which a round travels, diminishing the weapon's damage in the process. Suppressors can only be used on Ranged (Light) and Ranged (Heavy) slugthrower weapons.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Czerka Mk. I Suppressor, SoroSuub "Whisperflite" Slugthrower Silencer.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [SE][SE] to Perception or Vigilance checks made to locate a concealed shooter firing a silenced slugthrower.

ItemAttachments.Name: Motion Tracker
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Motion Tracker[h3]
The sophisticated device incorporates a full suite of onboard sensors and computers to track and predict the motion of a target, then feed that data back to the user through a variety of means, including a helmet HUD, a hardwirded feed  jacked directly into the brain, or other methods. The system might involve motive-actuators within the weapon to subtly adjust aim, or it might interface with motorized gloves. This attachement can be applied to any Ranged (Heavy) weapon.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] CryonCorp Xv3 "Surefire" Motion Predictor, Industrial Automaton A-3 Tracking Computer.

Mod.MiscDesc: Remove [SE] due to target movement or use of Guarded Stance.

ItemAttachments.Name: Varpeline Crystal
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Varpeline Crystal[h3]
Varpeline crystals are hard, super dense minerals found on the Outer Rim worlds of Mearalis II. Ranging in color from white to a rich gold, they are scattered througout Mearalis II's extensive mountain ranges. When properly worked, varpeline crystals can be used to slice through nearly any substance known in the galaxy. While they are typically used in industrial cutting machinery or precision fabrication instruments, these stones are occasionally used to great effect as lightsaber crystals.
[P]When installed in a lightsaber, this crystal produces a blade that emits a short, sharp ringing tone when it strikes an object. A lightsaber equpped with a varpeline  crystal can often cut through the thickest armor or toughest materials, and have a disturbing tendency to dismember living targets.

Mod.MiscDesc: When spending [TR] to inflict Critical Injury, may spend additional [TR] to automatically inflict Maimed Critical Injury.

ItemAttachments.Name: Nishalorite Stone
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Nishalorite Stone[h3]
Nishalorite stones are found on worlds with particularly strong magnetic fields. Usually dark gray or blue-black in color, and possessing powerful magnetic properties, these stones are often used in electronics and magnetic navigation equipment. once properly cleaned and refined, they also make for excellent lightsaber crystals, as discovered generations ago by a wandering Jedi Seeker.
[P]While installed in a lightsaber, this stone creates a dense crackling blade with a subdued color that intensifies in the direction of a planet's magnetic north. It can detect natural and artificially generated magnetic fields such as those produced by generators of powerful electronic systems.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add automatic [AD] to checks made to location position, navigate terrain, or find power sources or active technology.

ItemAttachments.Name: Water Reclamation Suit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Water Reclamation Suit[h3]
Water reclaimation systems are popular with scouts and hermits, especially those living or working on arid worlds. Produced by a variety of wilderness outfitters, like Survival Equipment Inc. and Gandorthral Atmospherics, these systems collect a body's waste moisture and distill it for drinking. Typically, the consist of a tight bodysuit worn under a suit of armor, that covers a wearer to the neck, wrists, and ankles, along with a matching pair of gloves and a filtermask that covers the mouth and nose.
[P]Made from layers of synthetic fibermesh, the suit wicks sweat away from the skin and purifies it by means of integrated filtration media. It also collects waste moisture from the mouth and nose by means of the filtermask. The water is then collected in pouches spread across the suit and can either be decanted into a larger container or drunk straight from the suit by means of a long, flexible tube connected to the suit's back. Adding a Water Reclamation System to a suit of armor allows an individual to operate much longer in desolate environments without fear of running out of water. This attachment can be applied to any armor that could logically integrate the necessary pouches and tubing.

Mod.MiscDesc: Upgrades ability of Resiliance and Survival checks made in dry or hot environments due to scarcity of water twice.

ItemAttachments.Name: Saddlebags
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Saddlebags[h3]
Made by purveyors of animal-handling gear such as VeTech and Piccatech, saddlebags are indispensable pieces of equipment for those wh make their livings riding or working with beasts. Constructed from hides or reinforced synthetic textiles, saddlebags typically compromise a pair of large containers with sealed flap covers, connected by a broad belt or  a number of cables. Saddlebags are designed to be portable. They can be thrown quickly over a beast's haunches and, if necessary, removed just as quickly to be carried over the shoulder by the beast's rider. Saddlebags fit countless riding animals, and can be customized functionally and cosmetically to meet an individual's particular tastes and needs.
[P]Saddlebags can only be worn by riding animals. They increase an animal's encumbrance threshold by 4.

ItemAttachments.Name: Passive Foliage Suit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Passive Foliage Suit[h3]
For those operating in the wilds, sometimes the simplest camoflage methods are the best. Given this, it's not surprising that hunters and other individuals who spend a lot of time in the wilderness often use passive foliage suits. These suits have patches of synthetic greenery designed to mimic natural flora. Clusters of opern tie-lines also allow wearers to easiliy attach local foliage to the suit, allowing them to alter their camouflage when the surroundings change. This attachment can be applied to any armor that could logically integrate the necessary patches and tie-lines.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various types.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [SE] to Perception or Vigilance checks made to detect a character wearing this armor in appropriate environment.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-1S) Hyperdrive Class 4 Module
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Hyperdrive Class 4 Module for AD-1S[h3]
Installing a hyperdrive, even
a relatively low-grade one, in an AD-IS takes up a
good deal of space inside of the craft, but also allows
it to operate independently. For many mercenaries,
bounty hunters, and other frequent travelers, such an
upgrade is well worth the cost.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add astromech droid socket.

ItemAttachments.Name: Engine Boost System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Engine Boost System[h3]
There are as many ways of boosting the output of a Podracer's engine as there are engines themselves. Afterburners, volatile chemical injectors, overpressure feeders, electro-magnetic wave-pusle generators, even arcane mixtures of highly reactive and dangerous fuels are all used to provide extra thrust from an engine. While these add-on systems do increase an engine's output, often dramatically so, they have a tendency to shorten its operational life and require extra maintenance to keep the engine operational and at peak performance.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Bespin Motors LK Model Afterburner Array, Slayn & Korpil Surgine-Series Fuel Accelerant System, SoroSuub RR-51 Chem-Injector Suite.

ItemAttachments.Name: Environmental Adaption Kit
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Environmental Adaption Kit[h3]
      The varied and often hazardour environments found throughout the galaxy have a tendency to hinder and harm even the sturdiest, most well-built pieves of equipment. Ranged weapons, especially energy weapons like blasters, are particularly susceptible to environmental damage. Dirt, dust and sand can scratch fog lenses, reducing a blaster beam's cohesion and therefore its range and damage potential. Moisture can collect in barrels and recievers, corroding galven circuitry or rusting bolts and strikers. More exotic environments can wear away at weapons with heat, caustic gases, or damaging ionization.
[P]To combat these dangers, most weapon and wepaon accessory manufacturers produce Environmental adaption kits. Primarly just collections of seals and protective covers, these kits grant a ewapon an added layer of protection against the wear and tear of regular use in hotile environments. While some are for general use, most of these kits are designed for specific environments: dusty, cold, caustic, etc. Environmental adaptation kits can be attached to any ranged weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Various models and manufacturers.
[P][I]Note: If this kit is for a specific environment, rename the kit to specify the environment.[i]

Mod.MiscDesc: Prevents a weapon from breaking down as a result of a specific type of environment.

ItemAttachments.Name: Enhanced XCiter
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Enhanced XCiter[h3]
Outlaw Techs have long known how to modify the gas
conversion enabler in a blaster to yield a more highly
energetic—and correspondingly more destructive—payload. Such modified XCiter modules are highly
unstable, however, and are sometimes disparaged as
being just as dangerous to the wielder and anyone
else nearby as to the enemy. Despite the risk and the
illegality of the modification, many outlaws seek out
such customizations to gain an edge in a firefight. This
attachment can be applied to any blaster.

Mod.MiscDesc: GM may spend [DE][DE] to cause blaster to explode, destroying blaster and inflicting automatic Critical Injury on wielder.

ItemAttachments.Name: (AD-1S) Sublight Boost Thrusters
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Sublight Boost Thrusters for AD-1S[h3]
The craft’s engines can
be equipped with sublight boosters, which considerably increase their output. Flying at higher speeds
also makes the vehicle harder to handle in rough conditions such as asteroid fields, but when outrunning a
patrol boat or pirate vessel, it can be the difference
between life and death.

ItemAttachments.Name: Damping Emitter
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Damping Emitter[h3]
Careful modifications to the power cells and blade emitter allow the owner of a lightsaber to add a stun setting of sorts, drawing on the power of a normal lightsaber crystal, but with less intensity than is normally used. A damped lightsaber can still inflict serious injuries, however, as the emitter can only limit the power of a heavily modified crystal so much.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Nonr; users must custom make each lightsaber attachment.

Mod.MiscDesc: As a maneuver, my adjust lightsaber to deal Stun damage.  Decrease damage by 2, increase critical rating by 1, lose Breach quality.
Stun Damage +1

ItemAttachments.Name: Mk. III Modular Backpack Accessory Pouch
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Mk. III Modular Backpack Accessory Pouch[h3]
Creshaldyne Industries' Mk. III Modular Backpack is a civilian version of its popular Mk. IV military reconnaissance pack. Like the Mk. IV, the Mk. III MB is a large, sturdy, internally supported backpack constructed of hard-wearing, weatherproof textiles. It has a single large interior space and two smaller external pockets that are sealed against the environment with a silent, tear away textile sealing system.. The Mk. III is also equipped with a system of hooks and fasteners that allows up to six smaller pouches to be attached to better tailor the backpack to the wearer's needs.

ItemAttachments.Name: Pannier Modular Cargo Handling System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Pannier Modular Cargo Handling System[h3]
Designed by Piccatech Ltd., the Pennier system is designed to fit as much cargo on a beast as it can carry in an efficient and secure manner. Its base is a specially designed load-bearing harness equipped with quick-release hardwar. From this harness, a beast handler or teamster can hang a variety of secure, hard sided cargo containers. Made from either plasteel or reinforced fiberweave, the cargo containers are buit in a variety of shapes and sizes to suit individual users' needs. The containers are equipped wotj am environmentally sealed locking lid that secures cargp and protects it from dirt, water and other contaminants.
[P]The Pannier Modular Cargo Handling system comes with two cargo containers and can only be worn by riding or working animals of silhouette 2 or larger. It increases the creature's encumbrance threshold by 6, plus an additional 3 points of encumbrance threshold for each additonal cargo containers added to the system (to a maximum increase of 12).

ItemAttachments.Name: Hunting Barrel
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Hunting Barrel[h3]
Designed to increase range and accuracy, a hunting barrel can turn any blaster rifle into a dedicated hunting weapon. This two-meter-long replacement barrel is constructed of lightweight materiels and packed with upgraded pulse adaptors and denser, more aggressive galven ciruitry. The increased accuracy and range come at the cost of the base weapon's weight and size, however. The extra-long barrel makes the weapon awkward to handle and fire without proper support, as well as making it almost impossible to conceal. A hunting barrel can only be used on a blaster rifle.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Czerka Model 2 "Huntsman" Precision Barrel, SoroSuub WQ60 "Sure-shot" Barrel, Arakyd 3100 "Deadeye" Barrel.

ItemAttachments.Name: Minelayer
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Minelayer[h3]
Minelayers, and their accompanying ordance, are anti-ship weapons sold by numerous mahor galactic arms manufacturers. Mines are typically deployed in defensive positions, used to deny areas to vehicle traffic or to create fire lanes for weapon emplacements, but they can also be used offensively in a manner similar to missile or torpedo launchers. They come in a variety of styles—from simple concussion mines to sophisticated gravity mines—and grant a small vessel such as a starfighter or patrol boat, a damage capacity well out of proportion to its size. This attachment can be installed on any starship.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] GSI M-L4 Seeker. Czerka Arms Mk. IX Proton Mine.

Mod.MiscDesc: Allows vehicle to carry a number of space mines equal to its silhouette.
Pilot or gunner may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to deploy a mine anywhere within close range.
Increase deployable range to medium
Increase mine capacity by 1

ItemAttachments.Name: Containment Field
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Containment Field[h3]
Designed for permanent installation, a containment field generator consists of two flat, cylindrical generators—one bolted to the floor, the other to the ceiling— that hold a single individual captive in a powerful stasis field. Individuals held in a containment field. Individuals held in a containment field wear megnetic binders and are suspended in mid-air, completley isolated from the world around them. When held in  a containment field, individuals are usually fitted with bio-signs monitors due to the field's distressing habit of causing heart attacks, brain damage, or death if it is not tuned correctly. This attachment can be installed on any vessel of silhoette 4 or higher.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Gordarl Weaponsmiths A1 Containment Field.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can hold one Silhouette 1 creature.  Creature can see, hear, and speak, but cannot move.
Operator can attack prisoner.  Prisoner must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] and suffers 1 damage per [FA] and one [TH] may be used to inflict 1 strain.

ItemAttachments.Name: Enhanced Prison Lockup
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Enhanced Prison Lockup[h3]
A prisoner lockup is an aftermarket modification that provides a ship with a comprehenisve prisoner handling and transporting system. It includes two cells that hold one human-sized individual each, with sufficient life support and basic necessities. The kit also includes numerous security systems for the lockup itself an the ship at large. Cameras and motion sensors are installed and powerful electronic locks are fitted to hatches and doors throughout the ship. This attachment can be installed on any vessel capable of carrying prisoners.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] Various models.

Mod.MiscDesc: Full incarceration and security suite for 2 prisoners.
Support for one additional prisoner.

ItemAttachments.Name: Micro-Rocket Armor Mounting
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Micro-Rocket Armor Mounting[h3]
Micro-rockets are flexible (if dangerous) weapons favored as secondary arms by many bounty hunters (see [B]Micro-Rockets[b] on page 46), and generally fired from a mount installed in the wielder's armor. This attachment can be intalled on any amor.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] BlasTech Mag-Clip Micro-Rocket Mounting, Goseia HIC "Last Word" Launch/Targeter System, countless custom variants.

Mod.MiscDesc: Enables armor to fire loaded micro-rockets.

ItemAttachments.Name: Vaksai Modification Package
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Vaksai Modification Package[h3]
A pre-fabricated kit of starship modifications sold by TransGalMeg for their Kihraxz modular light starfighter, this package includes upgraded engines and flight control systems, a heavier weapons loadout, and a higher-out-put shield generator. While expensive, those Kihraxz pilots who can afford it swear by the added surivability and firepower it provides, allowing the fighter to engage heavier targets and emerge victorious.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Vaksai Modification Package.

ItemAttachments.Name: Under-Barrel Micro-Rocket Rack
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Under-Barrel Micro-Rocket Rack[h3]
Micro-rockets can be fired in a plethora of ways, and some hunters mount them on their other weapons, giving these arms a deadly secondary fire mode (see [B]Micro-Rockets[b] on page 46). This attachment can be installed on any ranged weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Blastech "Finisher" Rocket Rack, TaggeCo Under-Barrel Rocket Battery.

Mod.MiscDesc: Enables weapon to fire loaded micro-rockets.

ItemAttachments.Name: Marked-Target Firing Lock
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Marked-Target Firing Lock[h3]
In the chaos of a firefight, shots can go astray, damaging property or bystanders. While some hunters do not care about the carnage they cause, this kind of haphazard damage is a liability, courting attention from the law or revenge from those who sugger in the crossfire. To mitigate this risk, some bounty hunters invest in firing locks on their blasters, allowing them to designate specific targets for the weapons. Once the systems' sensors have recognized a target, the weapons refuse to fire without a clear shot, minimizing the chance of collateral damage. This attachment can be installed on any ranged weapon that does not posess the Blast or Auto-fire quality.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] BlasTech "Surefire" Safety Sensor, Cadregg Armory Model-87 Weapon Sensor.

ItemAttachments.Name: Shock Pulse Emitter
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Shock Pulse Emitter[h3]
Shock pulse emitters operate along principles simlar to a blaster's stun setting, but at much shorter effective range—a range short enough to be of little use as weapons in themselves. However, when shock pulse emitters are integrated into weapons intended for close combat to begin with, they become effective combat tools to debilitate opponents and make a finishing blow easier to land. This attachment can be installed on any Melee or Brawl weapon.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Corellian Personal Defense Stun Pad.

ItemAttachments.Name: Replusor-Assisted Lifting
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Replusor-Assisted Lifting[h3]
Although more common among factory or warehouse labor crews than in battle, repulsor-assist systems have gained some popularity among bounty hunters who need to haul in heavy catches. The systems operate through a series of miniaturized repulsorlift generators placed at key joints throughout the amor, easing the weight of attached suits, as well as any loads they might support. Of course, the repulsorlift generators are tuned to reduce weight and pressure rather than exert force on their own, so some hunters prefer powered armor suits with lesser lifting capabilities but more general applications for their servos. This attachment can only be used with laminate armor and other full-body hard armor suits.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Guldak Heavy Industries Personal Repulsor Fitting.

ItemAttachments.Name: Rocket Guidance System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Rocket Guidance System[h3]
Most micro-rockets are fired directly at their target, relying on the firer's aim and the rocket's acceleration to ensure a direct hit. For those who prefer more insurance that their rockets land precisely where intended, packages of sensors, limited fuel cell expansions, and adjustable maneuvering fins allow for rockets to be modifed into maneuvering fins allow for rockets to be modified into "smart" weapons that continue to seek their designated target in the event of an initial miss or misfire. These systems enable users to get more reliable performance out of their rockets while at the same time minimizing the collateral damage. This attachment can be installed on any micro-rocket.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Phar Co. "Vornskr" Guidance Package, Merr-Sonn "Outreach" Target Sensor.

ItemAttachments.Name: Staged Rocket Booster
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Staged Rocket Booster[h3]
The limitations of size mean that most micro-rockets lack the fuel capacity to reach distant targets. However, high-yield fuel cells, advanced filtration systems, or staged boosters added to the rockets can all increase a rocket's effective range substantially. Of course, the term "effective range" becomes something of a misnomer with rockets modifed in this way, as the additional fuel risks unbalancing the rocket's flight path, and the increased range comes with an increased chance of misjudgement on the part of the user. However, the chance to deliver a hefty payload beyond the reach of equivalent retribution is worth the risk to many. This attachment can be installed on any micro-rocket.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] SoroSuub HV-33 Fuel Filter.

ItemAttachments.Name: Tracking System
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Tracking System[h3]
Through a series of specialized computer systems and sensors, this attachment collects and processes data from the wearer's surroundings to follow and predict the movements of designated targets. A heads-up display integrated into a helmet or visor feeds the wearer this information onto an overly of their surroundings. The systems are not limited to local targets, either, but can follow signals from distant communicators or tags and process optimal routes towards them. Tracking systems in armor are typically designed to operate alongside similar equipment, and are often able to integrate with other systems to a greater effect than the sum of their parts. This attachment can be installed on any armor.
[P][B]Models Include:[b] Galkor Solutions W-7 Locator Array.

Mod.MiscDesc: As a maneuver, may designate a target for tracking.  Only one target may be designated at a time.
Upgrade the ability of checks to track a designated target once.

ItemAttachments.Name: Integrated Holsters
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Integrated Holsters[h3]
By mounting their holsters into the framework of their armor, combatants can ensure no one can catch them unarmed. Not only does the wearer have easy access to these weapons at all times, but powered servos an other systems can be set up to assist the wearer in drawing or stowing these weapons more repidly. A character with  a fully tooled set of integrated holsters has access to a hidden arsenal that can overwhelm most foes.
[BR][B]Models Include:[b] BlasTech "Personal Armory" Gear.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [SE] to Perception checks to find stored weapons

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Landspeeder
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Landspeeder[h3]
      Converts a landspeeder to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds a medium laser turret

ItemAttachments.Name: Paramilitary Walker
ItemAttachments.Description:
[H3]Paramilitary Walker[h3]
      Converts a walker to a paramilitary vehicle.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds a forward medium laser cannon
